005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IYearMonthDurationItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
016
017import java.time.Period;
018import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
019import java.util.List;
020
021import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
022
023/**
024 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
025 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#year-month-duration">year-month-duration</a>
026 * data type.
027 */
028public class YearMonthAdapter
029    extends AbstractDataTypeAdapter<Period, IYearMonthDurationItem> {
030  @NonNull
031  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
032      List.of(
033          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "year-month-duration")));
034
035  YearMonthAdapter() {
036    super(Period.class, IYearMonthDurationItem.class, IYearMonthDurationItem::cast);
037  }
038
039  @Override
040  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
041    return NAMES;
042  }
043
044  @Override
045  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
046    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
047  }
048
049  @Override
050  public Period copy(Object obj) {
051    // value in immutable
052    return (Period) obj;
053  }
054
055  @SuppressWarnings("null")
056  @Override
057  public Period parse(String value) {
058    try {
059      return Period.parse(value);
060    } catch (DateTimeParseException ex) {
061      throw new IllegalArgumentException(ex.getLocalizedMessage(), ex);
062    }
063  }
064
065  @Override
066  public IYearMonthDurationItem newItem(Object value) {
067    Period item = toValue(value);
068    return IYearMonthDurationItem.valueOf(item);
069  }
070
071}
